intro: Olmedia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly olmedia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive, soft appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique texture and visual appeal. Olmedia tomentosa prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders.
